interlinear-text.item: ELA The meaning of Our Bilbilik [?]

phrase.item: My name is Vatansulton.
In[19]89 when my handsome brother was killed by the enemies, then I used to go up to the mountains and sing "Bilbilik" for my brother.
That helped me calm down and heal. After I would come home more relaxed.
By doing so I expressed my sorrow.
Well, when I was a child and my mother was in the summer pasture,
she used to sing bilbilik.
She also had sorrow and pain at that time. Her cousin had died in army and she used to sing for him.
I asked her, "Oh, mother! How do you sing bilbilik?"
She replied, "When a person
is sad and in deep sorrow, such as when someone closes to them passes away, then one sings bilbilik."
While my mother was alive, rosti dʒɨrʂ dan nə kərtəmət I didn't sing with her. Later, when my mother passed away, I also started singing bilbilik.
Now I also sing bilbilik.
I mention my mom's name and sing bilbilik for her.
How about your sister Niso?
Well, when i was fifty years old, my son was a student and when he was going from here to continue his studies he got into a car accident.
My son disappeared in the water and they never found him.
Then that pain and sorrow stayed inside me. Whenever I used to go to pasture, I kept singing bilbilik.
I learned from my aunt how to sing bilbilik.
Back at that time whenever she was sad, she used to sung. After that I also started singing bilbilik to my son.
Even till today I sing bilbilik sometimes and it calms me down.
Me too,
sometimes I keep singing bilbilik as if my mother has just passed away.
When a person's mother passes away, it as if you have nobody else left in this life.
So for that reason I keep repeatedly singing bilbilik.
Parents are the sweetest and most priceless people.
Parents are not forever.
Oh, poor children.
Bilbilik has existed from a long-ago ancient time. The older generation who used to sing all passed away
For several years it completely disappeared.
Then later we again started singing bilbilik.
A few years ago we started using bilbilik. Otherwise, there was a time when it completely disappeared.
It's good that it's back and we can express our emotions, sorrow with each other.
Afterwards it makes us feel calm and relaxed
and helps us to breath properly.
Otherwise, our sorrow and feelings would stay within us. Now we sing and it helps us,
each of us expresses our pain and sadness and when we return home, we feel good.
For instance, if we are on top of the mountain we all sing together, and raise our voices. But when we go herding in the mountains, we sing alone.
We also get together in town and sing together.
When we sing bilbilik loud, it wakes us feel much lighter.
One would sing loud and we join after her.
Well in our place men don't sing it.
But in Afghanistan they do sing, we can hear them sometimes.
In Namadgut [village], opposite our house, they do sing.
Sometimes when we wake up in the morning, we can hear them singing bilbilik.
In our place, men don't sing, only women sing [bilbilik].
To this day, the men haven't sung it yet.
Afghans sing, I have heard it myself
If they sing, they will probably sing well.
Back at that time there was a man called Bigek who lived here, he used to sing. Yeah, he did.
We were told that he used to sing.
We also have students who sing with us.
I have my own students as well and we all sing together with these women.
And there other [women] who sing as well.
My daughter who is still young, copies me whatever I sing
and sings like me. She has learned my talent,
such as singing bilbilik, and lullabies, anytime I sing she joins me. When I sing bilbilik she joins me,
that's why she just came after me.
